title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially stated he wasn't rooting for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX, prompting backlash from fans and players.
Brady later expressed support for Patriots owner Robert Kraft and the team on Instagram, encouraging them to win a 7th ring.
Brady's comments were criticized by former teammate Vince Wilfork and current player Robert Spillane for perceived lack of loyalty.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Former Colts Pro Bowler Jeff Saturday believes Patriots QB Drake Maye deserved NFL MVP over Rams QB Matthew Stafford.
Saturday highlighted Maye's superior QBR and versatility, arguing Maye succeeded without the elite weapons Stafford had.
ESPN analyst Mina Kimes also supported Maye for MVP, citing his efficiency, rushing ability, and higher completion rate.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots must increase pressure on Seahawks QB Sam Darnold, who struggled under pressure during regular-season games.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye may exploit Seattle's defense by scrambling, as Seahawks rank 29th in yards per rush allowed to QBs.
New England's top cornerback Christian Gonzalez may be crucial in defending against Seattle's star receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye, Patriots quarterback, will play in the Super Bowl without an injury designation after participating fully in practice.
Linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are questionable due to knee and ankle injuries respectively for the Super Bowl.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is questionable with a hamstring injury but was a full practice participant all week.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' featuring Chris Pine and Ben Foster is streaming on Netflix.
The romantic comedy 'Splitsville' with Kyle Marvin can be watched on Hulu.
Watch the 2026 Winter Olympics live with Peacock's Gold Zone coverage.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs inspired the Patriots with the phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' during a challenging season.
The slogan has become popular in New England, uniting fans and players as the Patriots reached the Super Bowl.
Despite legal issues, Diggs remains a key leader for the Patriots, known for his motivational influence and success.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, 34, from North Attleboro, is running her first marathon at the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Demeris is raising money for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund, supporting emergency response, cancer care, and the Home Base Program.
Her participation honors personal connections, including a best friend who is a nurse and her husband, a first responder and veteran.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets will close its South End location in June after 28 years, citing costly building updates.
The Croft School initially planned to take over the space but withdrew due to neighborhood objections.
A petition opposing the site's conversion to a non-retail space has gathered over 1,500 signatures.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: An Instagram account, @DrakeMayeLover, has gained nearly 400,000 followers since its creation in May 2024.
The account, dedicated to Patriots quarterback Drake Maye, frequently posts memes and sells related merchandise.
The account owner remains anonymous but may reveal their identity upon meeting Drake Maye and obtaining a photo.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality about the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup, disappointing some Patriots fans.
Brady stated on the "Let's Go!" podcast he had no preference in the Super Bowl, citing a new chapter in New England.
Responses to Brady's stance varied, with some fans feeling let down and others understanding his neutral position.
